title: Anyone want to review my portfolio before submitting?
content:
Hey Everyone,

I'm going to be submitting my portfolio, a few links, and my resume for a job this week and wanted to have some members here go over part of it.

[http://www.rosem.com/work/portfolio/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720132519/http:/www.rosem.com/work/portfolio/ "http://www.rosem.com/work/portfolio/")

I'm basically looking for any feedback/suggestions along with typos, etc...

It's for a Web Development job, but I thought I would add this section which shows more of my print design work.

Thanks,  
Mike
author: rosem

comments.content: Your navigation arrows are very hard to see. I almost missed them entirely. I would make it navigable by clicking on the picture, also, if you can't lighten the arrows.

If you go to [http://www.rosem.com/work/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720132519/http:/www.rosem.com/work/ "http://www.rosem.com/work/") you get to see the entire directory structure and get an access to a lot of different works and files that might not be intended for visitors. Might be a good idea to create a blank index.html there.  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Personal Art and Design Portal of Ivan Gulkov  
 [www.ivangdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120720132519/http:/www.ivangdesign.com/ "www.ivangdesign.com")

I could see the arrows, but maybe I was a bit influenced by just reading Sharons comment.

I think it looks nice. It's clean. It was very fun to see the logos that you've posted on here before for critique.

If anything I might work on some of the comments about the work. I'm not sure at this point it really adds to the work. I'd suggest either using more in-depth commentary or just leave it totally basic, like just use the company name that the actual design was for.

Nice works. And — That sure seems like a smooth flash showcase. _(Did you base it on an existing system or create it yourself / from scratch, if I may ask?)_

Dav
